title: Google\Cloud\Core\Iam\Iam
name: Iam
description:
IAM Manager

This class is not meant to be used directly. It should be accessed through other objects which support IAM.

Policies can be created using the Google\Cloud\Core\Iam\PolicyBuilder to help ensure their validity.

examples.caption: IAM policies are obtained via resources which implement IAM. In this example, we'll use PubSub topics to demonstrate how IAM policies are managed.

methods.name: policy
methods.description:
Get the existing IAM policy for this resource.

If a policy has already been retrieved from the API, it will be returned. To fetch a fresh copy of the policy, use Google\Cloud\Core\Iam\Iam::reload().

params.name: options['requestedPolicyVersion']
params.description: Specify the policy version to request from the server. Please see policy versioning for more information.

methods.name: setPolicy
methods.description:
Set the IAM policy for this resource.

Bindings with invalid roles, or non-existent members will raise a server error.

params.name: policy
params.description: The new policy, as an array or an instance of Google\Cloud\Core\Iam\PolicyBuilder.

exceptions.description: If the given policy is not an array or PolicyBuilder.

methods.name: testPermissions
methods.description:
Test if the current user has the given permissions on this resource.

Invalid permissions will raise a BadRequestException.

returns.description: A subset of $permissions, with only those allowed included.

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Refresh the IAM policy for this resource.
